Even now Kel has crept down to the lowest level of the sanctum and completed the ritual to release Setarra from her crystal prison. The demon emerges, singing the song to summon the great Leviathans from the lower depths.

Will the Magister stop the Leviathans from dragging the crystal into depths? Will Setarra free the rest of the demons from their prison?

Will the twins turn on each other, or betray their masters?

Why were the demons imprisoned? Does anyone remember? Can enemies change their beliefs, or are duty and vengeance the only ways?

172853.name: Degenesis Rebirth Edition (Limited Edition)
172853.description:
From the publisher's webpage:

Mankind is under siege.
The enemies of Homo Sapiens are drawing closer. Day by day, they gain more followers, more territory, more power.
AMSUMO machine men stalk the ruins in preconditioned patterns. Sleepers, elite soldiers from the past awake to bathe civilization in warfare and bloodshed. Marauders, rotting, undying gods wield weapons of mass destruction and wreak havoc across the land.

But man has to face his greatest enemy yet:
Homo Degenesis, spawn of the Primer, rises from the craters, each breed wielding powers that bend the laws of reality.
Shapeshifting, precognition, psychokinesis, these aberrants are the peak of evolution. The insect swarms of the world come to do their bidding. Where Homo Degenesis claims territories, the earth rots and spore fields burst sepsis into the air, tolling the final bell in the Primers plan.

Humanity’s time has come:
Raise the weapons, fight back, or be forgotten. Forever.

Contents:
· 2 HARDCOVER BOOKS, 704 FULL COLOR PAGES IN A HARDCOVER SLIPCASE
· SIGNED AND NUMBERED
· EXCLUSIVE STORYTELLER SCREEN “VASCO EDITION”
· A1 WORLD MAP POSTER FEATURING TOPOGRAPHICAL VIEWS OF EUROPE AND AFRICA
· ONE SET OF EXCLUSIVE “DEGENESIS CULT CARDS” (FEATURING 13 CARDS & RULES)

172854.name: Degenesis Rebirth Edition (Artist Edition)
172854.description:
From the publisher's webpage:

Mankind is under siege.
The enemies of Homo Sapiens are drawing closer. Day by day, they gain more followers, more territory, more power.
AMSUMO machine men stalk the ruins in preconditioned patterns. Sleepers, elite soldiers from the past awake to bathe civilization in warfare and bloodshed. Marauders, rotting, undying gods wield weapons of mass destruction and wreak havoc across the land.

But man has to face his greatest enemy yet:
Homo Degenesis, spawn of the Primer, rises from the craters, each breed wielding powers that bend the laws of reality.
Shapeshifting, precognition, psychokinesis, these aberrants are the peak of evolution. The insect swarms of the world come to do their bidding. Where Homo Degenesis claims territories, the earth rots and spore fields burst sepsis into the air, tolling the final bell in the Primers plan.

Humanity’s time has come:
Raise the weapons, fight back, or be forgotten. Forever.

Contents:
· ONLY 100 COPIES
· 2 HARDCOVER BOOKS, 704 FULL COLOR PAGES
IN A HANDCRAFTED DELUXE BOX
· SIGNED & NUMBERED
· A3 ARCHIVAL QUALITY ART PRINT BY GERALD PAREL
· A3 ORIGINAL DRAWING BY MARKO DJURDJEVIC

172857.name: The Sandbox (Number One - Jan 2015)
rpgissuearticle: A Quick Backwater Spaceport: A One-Roll Generator
Kickstarter Production Guidelines: Procedural Notes for the Aspiring RPG Creator
The Last Prince: A New Class for Scarlet Heroes
The Sandbox: A Journal of Sandbox Gaming from Sine Nomine Publishing
What’s That Abandoned Structure?: A One-Roll Generator
172857.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to The Sandbox, a free irregular journal from Kevin Crawford and Sine Nomine Publishing. Sine Nomine fans have noticed the regular flow of freebie material I've produced, such as the Mandate Archive series for Stars Without Number, Black Streams for the Red Tide setting, and other free releases for other systems and particulars. The Sandbox is meant to be an umbrella for these free resources, packed with the short articles, quick-roll tables, and GM helps that others have found so useful.

In this thirteen-page issue of The Sandbox, you'll find...

The Last Prince, a new class for Scarlet Heroes. The final scion of a doomed people? Use this class to bear the grim scars of your past and avenge the memory of your vanished kind.
Kickstarter Production Guidelines, where I lay out the exact production sequence I use for Sine Nomine Kickstarters, providing step-by-step instructions on how to manage the workflow and execution of a successful RPG Kickstarter. Learn how to manage project scope, plan layout, handle art completion with art control sheets, and sidestep Fulfillment Hell with at-cost codes and shipping specifics. Find the gritty details of execution here that are all too often neglected by creators.
A Quick Backwater Starport is a one-roll generator for swiftly brewing up a backwater world's main starport. Roll one of each die and find out just what the problems are to be found in this scraggly outpost of starfaring civilization.
What's That Abandoned Structure? will help a GM quickly determine the details of an abandoned building. Whether a long-lost relic consumed by an unfriendly wilderness or a gutted husk in a forgotten alien city, this quick-roll table gives the GM the answers they need to provide playable content at the table.




So go ahead and grab this inaugural issue of The Sandbox. Keep an eye peeled for additional issues as the year progresses, each one packed with short material to help other indie publishers, support other Sine Nomine games, or just help you make good sandbox fun for your own favorite system.

172858.name: M80
172858.description:
It’s time to bust out the fireworks, but be careful. You don’t want an M80 to explode in your hand, you will lose it. They are powerful little things. Players take turns playing a card on a players hand, Follow the rules of the cards to see what happens. The goal of the game is to acquire the most points by the end of the game. There is a chance to secure points with the dud card, but other than that whatever you have in your hand at the end will be your score. You must watch out for the M80, they empty your hand. Enjoy and remember, fireworks are not toys!. Set things on fire responsibly!

Set Up:

The last person to light a firecracker goes first. That person chooses a dealer.
Deal 4 cards to each player and everyone discards 1




Form a discard pile next the remainder of cards which is now the draw pile.

Each player will organize the cards in their hand and hold then face up in front of them. Only the top card will be visible. The game consists of always showing one card from your hand while the rest of your hand is underneath.




Play:
The person to go first will decide on who will get the first card. They may choose themselves or any other player.

They will draw one card from the draw pile and give it to that person face up so everyone can see.




That card is to be played on the card showing in that players hand.

If it’s a match, it lights a firework showing as the action on the card goes into effect.
If it’s a lighter, the player gets to decide on the card in the other persons hand they wish to act on, but they don’t get to look, just announce. Ex. 2nd card, 3rd card down.
if it’s a firework card it goes on the top of the pile in that player’s hand.
a match or lighter played on a match or lighter just gets added to that player’s hand with no action.
The player who was chosen will go next. (You could keep choosing yourself, but there are M80’s in the deck that will wipe you out).




Conclusion:
Play continues until there are no more cards to draw. The cards left in your hand at the end of the game are totalled and scored. if you have any cards in front of you as result of the dud, you add them to your hand total and that’s your score. The highest score wins. If a tie, the player with the most of the highest point value cards wins.

172859.description:
If Kickstarter backers pledged at Noble level or higher each copy of Dragon Valley came with three exclusive King's Aid Cards (Lure, Teleport and Monument) that will not be included in the production run of the game.

Lure - Why let your opponents get all the glory for defeating formidable foes? Use rumors of treasures to lure dragons and orcs to your heroes.

Teleport - Your lands are vast. To quicken your advance to the front lines or into a siege in the valley, the King can send a mage that specializes in teleportation.

Monument - In an effort to demonstrate the greatness of your Barony, this ability allows you to use building materials towards a great monument, scoring end game points.
172859.name: Dragon Valley: Kickstarter Exclusive – Kings Aid Cards

172860.name: Delicious: Emily's New Beginning
172860.description:
Plotwise, Delicious: Emily's New Beginning picks up where Emily's Honeymoon Cruise left off. The core gameplay of the game is the same as always, with all the variety that engine brings; however something that is new in this game is the ability to choose which dishes to serve to the customers who are likely to come, according to the forecast. This element gives you more control, and allows you to aim for bigger tips by delighting your customers with their favorite dishes.

User summary by zefquaavius

172861.name: Car Mechanic Simulator 2014
172861.description:
Now you can own and operate your own auto repair service with PlayWay’s Car Mechanic Simulator 2014.
Car Mechanic Simulator 2014 gives you the behind the scenes view of the daily dealings at local garages and dealership repair shops.

- Interact with car owners seeking repairs
- Order parts and materials necessary to maintain inventory including used car parts to help keep consumer costs low.
- Purchase repair manuals to enable you to work better, faster and earn more income!
- Work on eight different car models including Town Cars, Compacts, Sedans, SUVs, Family Cars, SUVs VANs, and Limousines
- Gain experience with over 120 different repairs including brakes, transmission fixes, body shop work, steering and alignment adjustments, chip tuning, diagnostic analysis, test drive pad, OBD scanning, oil changes, fix broken parts and engage in dozens of other tasks.

Car Mechanic Simulator 2014 is a must have for auto mechanics and fans of the world’s most popular autos!

Source: The Publisher Website.

172862.name: Dazzling Zoo
172862.description:
Welcome to Dazzling Zoo! In our zoo, we only have 5 different animals. Just don't turn round and leave! Our animals are not as usual. Come in and try to figure out their face, color and living place. Only the visitor who has clearest mind will successfully recognize the right animal. So, feel free to explore this dazzling zoo and look how colorful our zoo is, and make sure that you won't feel dizzy after visiting our zoo. Have fun!

Dazzling Zoo is a game that need players to recognize different conditions the next card shows on its back. There are 3 conditions on each card's back, which is 'animal', 'animal's color', and 'living place'. Once the zoo face shows up, player need to figure out the right answer and touch the right tile as soon as possible. However, players should also beware of trapping situation, that if the zoo face is exactly the same as the answering tile, the right tile immediately becomes the wrong tile. Therefore, it is not a game for the quickest player, but for the player with cautiousness as well.

172863.name: Delicious: Emily's Wonder Wedding
172863.description:
Delicious: Emily's Wonder Wedding continues the story where Delicious: Emily's True Love leaves off. Prepare and serve dishes, as well as tackling occasional other tasks, such as… preparing for your wedding! François is his usual quasi-helpful self as you strive to keep everyone happy, no matter how unusual their needs, all while running your restaurant!

User summary by zefquaavius

172864.name: Delicious: Emily's Honeymoon Cruise
172864.description:
Delicious: Emily's Honeymoon Cruise continues the story where Wonder Wedding leaves off, of course. Prepare and serve dishes at top speed, mostly aboard a cruise ship; however, there are a few beach scenes to keep you on your toes. Emily's sister, Angela, is featured in quite a few levels, offering up clothing, instead of food. In addition to the usual strong plot, Honeymoon Cruise makes additional use of multistage preparations, particularly for Angela's clothing, which needs to be manufactured — of course while the shop is open, people are buying, and people are trying on clothes.

User summary by zefquaavius

172865.name: iPollute
172865.description:
iPollute is [clearly] a pollution-themed videogame, presented in fully animated "claymation". The gameplay is simple: Press one of the menu buttons to decide what action, with environmental impact, you will take next. You must puzzle out the optimal sequence of actions to prolong your game, and eventually clean up the ecological mess you are making.

User summary by zefquaavius

172866.description:
Dragon Punch is a quick two-player card game inspired by video games such as the Street Fighter series, in which the players try to outwit each other with the timing and positioning of their attacks and defenses.

In each round the goal is to reduce the opponent's health to zero. During each turn, both players choose a "move" card from their hands. Moves might attack, block or evade at a particular location (high or low) and speed. The chosen moves are then simultaneously revealed and compared, usually dealing damage or shifting the initiative.

The guessing game is never exactly the same; chosen cards may not be used again for a time, taking damage gives players the opportunity to secretly upgrade their moves, and each player also has a unique character card with special moves.

Dragon Punch was designed to be very portable: It consists of only a few cards, and it also doesn't require a table or other surface to play. This means you can have a quick brawl against a friend almost anywhere!
172866.name: Dragon Punch
boardgamepodcastepisode: PNPCAST 008: Wizard Dice & Dragon Punch
Review: Dragon Punch

172867.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Mind Flayer Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature, upgrade cards and tokens.
172867.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Mind Flayer Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

172868.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Pegasus Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature, upgrade cards and tokens.
172868.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Pegasus Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

172869.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Griffon Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature, upgrade cards and tokens.
172869.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Griffon Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

172870.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Goblin Fighter Troop Expansion Pack includes six pre-painted miniatures, upgrade cards and tokens.
172870.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Goblin Fighter Troop Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

172871.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Ogre Mage Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature, upgrade cards and tokens.
172871.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Ogre Mage Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

172872.description:
From the publisher:

This fantastic pre-painted premium figure stands several inches tall and towers over all of the other D&D Attack Wing expansion pack miniatures. The perfect encounter for your next adventure, or the perfect ally to your force. The D&D Attack Wing Silver Dragon Premium Figure is a beautiful display piece as well!

The D&D Attack Wing version of the Silver Dragon figure also comes with additional play materials such as Cards, Tokens, Maneuver Dials, and a 6” x 6” D&D Attack Wing base.
172872.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Silver Dragon Premium Figure
boardgamefamily: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

172873.description: A limited release promo for The Red Dragon Inn first released at Gencon 2014 and available at the SlugFest Games booth. Shuffle or replace a card in any Red Dragon Inn Drink Deck with Eve's Mystery Mead to add a bit more excitement to your game!
172873.name: The Red Dragon Inn: Eve's Mystery Mead
boardgameexpansion: The Red Dragon Inn: Gambling? I'm In!

172874.name: The Russian Empire Strikes Back: Lodz 1914
172874.description: This is a operational scale war game based on the World War One battle between Germany and Russia.

172875.description:
Drillit! A Fuga da Montanha de Cristal is a cooperative game where player are gnomes excavating the Crystal Mountain with a big drill-tank. With the increasing noise of the drilling, the gnomes woke the evil goblins! Now, you and your friends have to flee the Crystal Mountain before the Goblins destroy the tank and you perish in their hands!

The goal of the game is to reach the other side of the board, placing path tiles to do so.

The active player always draw an event card from the deck, and resolves it. After that, the player has 4 Action Points to spend in some actions: Move, Kill Goblins, Repair, Extinguish Fire, Excavate and Use Crystals.
172875.name: Drillit! A Fuga da Montanha de Cristal

172876.name: Binbou-Tougeika
172876.description:
User summary:

Poor Potter is the English name given to the Japanese game 貧乏陶芸家 (Binbou-Tougeika) by the game designer Taiki Shinzawa.

The players are a group of young potters, who, due to poverty, can't afford the clay to produce pottery works. Under the circumstances, you show the plan of your upcoming work to solicit clay from other potters, and the player who has supplied the highest amount of clay can receive the work. The produced work may be worthless now, but its value is sure to rise in 10 years time.

Players bid on pottery work cards by the weight of the clay they supply, and the player who earns the highest score by adding the points for the clay and cards wins. An electronic scale is provided as a component of the game and used to weigh the clay, as the precise weights matter to the result.

Designer's summary:
"あなたたちは若き陶芸家です。ですが貧乏なので陶芸を作る粘土もありません。なのでこんな陶芸を作りますという企画を出して材料の粘土を仲間に出してもらいます。そうして出来た陶芸は粘土を出してくれた仲間にあげます。いまは価値の無い陶芸ですが、10年後には立派な値になっていることでしょう。
粘土をお金に重量で、オークショナーが出した陶芸カードを競って、集めていきます。ゲーム終了時にもらった粘土とカードの得点を合計して最も高い人がゲームに勝利します。重量の判定には電子ばかりを使用します。"

172877.description: A game of chess played on a game of chess with two sets of chess pieces: a big set that carries a small set. The goal of the game is to take the small king. On a move the small pieces can either move across the tops of the big pieces or pilot the big piece they're on. Small pieces cannot leave their big piece board unless there is an adjacent big piece to legally move to, and can move across several adjacent big piece boards in a move as long as the move is legal and uninterrupted by gaps.
172877.name: Meta Chess

172878.name: La Toile d'Arachné Solara (Number 1 - May/Jun/Jul 1994)
172878.description:
Ce numéro concentre sur la sorcellerie dans RuneQuest III. [This issue focuses on Sorcery in RuneQuest III.]

Table des matières [Contents]:

Polémique : :La Sorcellerie et les malkionis ... une étrange relation
Edito
Pour que La Toile vive ...




La Section " Une approche du monothéïsme malkioni: Les Rokari "

La société rokari de Seshnela
L'Église Rokari
Résumé Chronologique de l'Histoire du Malkionisme
Les Secrets de Malkion
Les Brumes de Tarasdal (Scénario)

172879.name: RUS: Age of the Vikings
172879.description:
RUS: Age of the Vikings is a strongly themed military and economic strategy game set in Viking Age Russia, in which up to 5 players compete to become Czar of the Rus. It deliberately sets out to marry the elegant inclusivity of Eurogames with the thematic gameplay of a classic Amerigame.

Each turn, players choose 6 of 9 Actions that drive the game. Will you send out Envoys to engage in Diplomacy, Harvest your crops, Trade with foreign powers, Construct settlements, invest in Culture & Technology or Recruit troops to engage in warfare? The player who chooses the Action gains a bonus, but all other players simultaneously take part in each Action Phase that is chosen.

It is possible to win the game without ever engaging in warfare, but for those who prefer blood, combat uses a Tactics Card system which means you have to out-think your opponent to beat them in battle.

As in history, Politics Cards provide a random element, introducing new Kingdoms (like the Muscovites or the Golden Horde) or triggering good harvests, famine and ultimately the Black Death.

The first player to score 8 Victory Points wins the game, but if the Black Death is triggered before this happens, all Kingdoms are hit by the plague. The survivors then take stock to see who is the most powerful in the new world that emerges.

With virtually no down-time and multiple routes to victory, RUS: Age of the Vikings provides a dynamic strategic experience within a playing time of about 30 mns per player.

172880.name: La Toile d'Arachné Solara (Number 2 - Dec 1994)
172880.description:
Ce numéro concentre sur les hommes bêtes de Génertéla. [This issue focuses on beastmen in Genertela.]

Table des matières [Contents]:

Edito
Exergue : Les Hommes-Bêtes, ces innconnus ...
Tous ce que vous avez toujours voulu savoir sur ... Le Pueple-Bête
Les Centaures
Les Minotaures
Les Ithilians-Fanes
Les Faunes
Les Canards
La Crinière des Ancêtres(Scénario)

172881.description:
Dwarves are among the bravest, determined and hard workers creatures you can find. Especially when they are searching for crystals in a new mine.

In Quartz, you belong to a group of dwarves who has just discovered a new mine on their land. Excited by the discovery, you decided to make a bet. Everyone will explore the mine for five days. At the end of each day you will sell in the city, the crystals you extracted during this day. At the end of the fifth day, the dwarf who earned the most money will become the only owner of the mine.

Following along the same lines as its predecessor, Ouro de Tolo, Quartz is fast and tense game of push-your-luck and risk management in which the players, acting as dwarven miners, try to secure the best crystals for themselves while keeping their "colleagues" at bay. Each turn a player has three choices:


Extract a crystal, i.e., pull a crystal from the bag. 
Play a card that brings him advantages or causes problems for opponents.
Leave the mine for that workday and cash in sets of crystals collected that day.


Some of the main differences to the previous game are that now theres is only 5 rounds, you have more strategic actions and every card is worth victory points at the end of the game, it's possible to save up crystals from one round to the other, whenever two unstable crystal explodes you get experience tokens that will save you later, and a set collection that can double or sum more cash each round.

What do you say? Will you accept this challenge?
172881.name: Quartz
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 022 – Origins 2016
RDTN Episode 101: The Networks, America, Quartz, and the Flying Squirrels
Vox Republica 135: Gaming Difficulty

172882.description: 16 updated recruit cards for Euphoria. These cards replace 16 cards of the same name in the first edition of Euphoria (the edition without "Mensa Winner" or “Morning Players” on the box).
172882.name: Euphoria: Updated Recruit Cards (16)

172883.description:
Saratoga is a board game that represents air-naval military maneuvers. Each player has 4 ships (one aircraft carrier, two cruisers and one destroyer), 12 jets and 6 surface-to-surface missiles. On land area are airport, port, launchers of missiles and anti-aircraft guns.

The main characteristic is that the game board is covered with a net of equilateral triangles. Vertices of these triangles are points at which the players hold position and move figurines.

Players have task to shoot at the opponent's ships and planes, as well as targets on its territory. The destroyer is sunk when received one hit. The carrier and cruiser are sunk when they receive 3 hits. Each hit in any target counts as one point. The game lasts as long as players have airplanes, ships and missiles to shoot at opponent. The winner is the player who has the best ratio of given and received hits.
172883.name: Saratoga

172884.name: De Fabeltjeskrant: Dierentroef
172884.description:
English description:
The 'Fabeltjeskrant' animal trump game is a colourful cordage for children aged 3 and above. Each round players play a card. The highest card takes all played cards. Player with the most cards wins the game.
The 'Fabeltjeskrant' theme is known by any Dutch person which makes it very recognisable for everyone.

Dutch description:
Met 'De Fabeltjeskrant Dieren Troef' proberen de spelers elkaar af
te troeven met hun Fabeltjeskrantdieren! Het programma is in 2005
uitgeroepen tot 'Beste Nederlandse Kinderprogramma Aller Tijden'.

De Fabeltjeskrant Dieren Troef is een kleurig kaartspel voor kinderen vanaf 3 jaar. De spelers leggen om de beurt een kaartje op tafel: wie het hoogste kaartje legt, krijgt alle gelegde
kaartjes. De speler die uiteindelijk alle kaartjes bezit, wint DierenTroef!

172885.description:
Blindes Huhn ("Blind Hens") is a bluffing card game with bidding mechanisms. You start with a set of eight chicken cards with values from 1 to 3 in your display in front of you. The auctioneer draws three cards from a pile and decides to show one or two of these cards to the other players; the other card(s) are kept secret. The auctioneer makes a bid, then the other players in clockwise order may make theirs. The highest bid wins the three cards from the pile — and has to pay with the cards from his display.

The cards in the pile bring more value to your chicken (1-4) and blind hens, which is three points minus alone, but +5 together with a Golden Corn. A single Corn is worth 2 points.

The 2015 edition of Blindes Huhn has mouse and hawk symbols on the cards for a variety of additional options and rules, making this new edition more than a simple reprint.
172885.name: Blindes Huhn

172886.description:
In Villagers & Villains: City Builder, each mayor gets two City Upgrade Tokens. Mayors use these tokens to develop their village by placing them on the new City Cards. Since 18 City Cards come with City Builder, and each time you play the game a few City Cards are used, players get a wider variety of game experiences. During play, mayors gain added play options by placing their City Tokens on any available City Card. Each City Card in the expansion grants unique abilities—and provides added points to the final score—for up to 2 mayors per card.

The City Builder expansion comes with components and rules to increase the maximum number of players from 5 to 6. In addition, this expansion comes with 6 town mats to give your village an identity, provide a quick reference guide for game play, and to organize game components, tokens, and gold.

The City Builder expansion also comes with new play options including: team play, cooperative play, and house rules for added variety.
172886.name: Villagers & Villains: City Builder

172887.name: Quest for Excellence
172887.description: Quest for Excellence is a take on the game Scrabble, but it adds a different way of playing. There are these cards, kind of quest cards with questions on. If you get the questions right you score extra points in the game, with a bonus if you collect sets of 3 of the card types, by getting all three questions on a card correct. If you do you keep the card and add it to you set of those cards. There are also no double or triple words score blocks on the board, but point amounts for placing a vowel or consonant on a specific place on the board. The board looks like a Scrabble board, but the scoring just works different. The tiles also have a score amount as stated on the board. I would so think of this game as Scrabble, but with more bells and whistles.

172888.name: Fateful Concepts: Character Aspects
172888.description:
From the introduction:
When Spirit of the Century came out at the end of 2006, I became an instant fan of it and Fate overall. In the last eight years, I’ve watched many people experiment with the system, trying all sorts of hacks, some which have since become in a sense canonical Fate rules. Other experiments were successful in a different way—not because they worked, but because they spurred conversation that helped our community better understand Fate.

This collection of articles is part of that spirit of understanding and experimentation. It’s not a rules update so much as a compilation of findings and explanations that have evolved over the years—both as a long-time fan and also working as Leonard Balsera’s co-conspirator on The Dresden Files Roleplaying Game and Fate Core System.

In this collection, I’ll focus on some character creation and character aspect topics. These are a hybrid of designer’s notes and thought experiments, which you are welcome to integrate and remix into your Fate publications. Some of these thoughts come from posts on my blog (RyanMacklin.com), which have been expanded based on comments and questions I’ve received since they were posted.

172889.name: Fateful Concepts: Hacking Concepts
172889.description:
From the introduction:
Of the three main ways of handling dramatic action in Fate Core—challenges, contests, and conflicts—contests seems to be talked about the least. But when I play Fate these days, I find that I use contests more and more to handle opposition. They’re great for races against the clock, for direct competition for access or resources, and even for some combat situations.

Really, there’s little that contests can’t do in Fate. This collection of essays and rules shows a variety of ways to remix the contest framework for a host of situations. The examples in this book focus on the personal scale, because that’s the most common scale played in roleplaying games, but they easily shift the larger scales by applying the Fate fractal.

172890.name: Every Round Counts: The Dice Game
172890.description:
A push your luck dice game

You are a bartender serving drinks in the bar, the more you serve the bigger your chance of you getting the tips

The one with the most tips wins the game

172891.description:
A Tribal deck-building card game

You are an Orc Lord trying to build the biggest following to become the Orc Overlord

Each round you draw 5 cards from your deck, each player in turn places their cards in front of them (following the text if any), each player is trying to get the highest combat rating from their cards. The player with the highest combat rating takes the round card (which is worth 5 points at the end of the game),then starting from the second player, the players takes a card from the draft card selection area, the player who finished first in the round chooses the last. These cards are add to the players discard pile, the game continues for 12 rounds at the end of the game the players add up the card value on the bottom of each card and adds it to any round cards they have won, the player with the most points wins the game.
172891.name: Tinku
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 13 - YuGiOh & Tabletop Gaming Mag

172893.description:
Mobile Armour Jousting pits two mobile armours - the agile mechanoid suits you see on the news putting down Jovian revolts and guarding the President - against each other in one-on-one combat. The aim isn't so much to kill your opponent as to force them out of the ring, sumo-style; once you damage their engines a bit they'll probably do it themselves just by accident, MAs are hard enough to control at the best of times.

A lot of colonists think that the MAJ circuit is their ticket Earthside, and the prizes are certainly magnificent. But the tricks you learn docking with fuel ships or dodging bandits under the rings of Saturn don't prepare you for a Mobile Armour. There's nothing like it; these beasts are as twitchy as they are powerful. And that's not to mention that the Extra-Solar Tournament is the only open tourney that unranked knights from the colonies can even enter, and that's held right the way out in the Reaches where you're just as likely to be hit by a lump of floating rock as a missile from your opponent...

MAJESTY - Mobile Armour Jousting: Extra-Solar Tournament - is a dexterity game in which you move little cardboard tokens around on a hex map. Players take turns to flick discs on their control boards - one for Throttle and one for Manoeuvre thrusters - which determine whether their Mobile Armour executes a perfect slide behind the enemy mecha to deliver a solid shot to the rear or spins wildly in place before careening off in the wrong direction. Players' mecha retain momentum from previous turns' acceleration, and half the challenge is to stay in the arena while being buffeted by cannon fire and homing missiles.

The use of small control boards means that unlike many dexterity games, MAJESTY doesn't require a large, flat and smooth surface upon which to play.
172893.name: MAJESTY
boardgamepodcastepisode: PNPCAST 012: Roll for the Tournament & MAJESTY

172894.description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

In December 1912, Germany, Austria-Hungary and Italy renewed their 30-year-old military pact known as the Triple Alliance. In the months that followed, staff officers from all three fleets prepared detailed plans for operations against the French and British fleets in the Mediterranean in case of war. Yet when war came in August 1914, Italy refused to join her Alliance partners and those plans would never be used.

What if Italy had honored her Alliance obligations, and joined the Germans and Austrians in a naval war against Britain and France? What if the Triple Alliance plans had been put into operation, with the Austrian and Italian fleets combining to challenge the French and British? The Great War at Sea in the Mediterranean is no longer confined to the Adriatic Sea, but now rages across the entire Mediterranean basin.

Triple Alliance is a book supplement for the Great War at Sea series based on those plans. It is not a complete game; ownership of Mediterranean and Dreadnoughts (and only Mediterranean and Dreadnoughts) is required to enjoy all of the scenarios.

The book includes 90 new scorchless, sootless laser-cut playing pieces. There are several versions of the Austrian battleship Radetzky, both the small dreadnought and full dreadnought variations presented by her design team in 1907. The all-big-gun battleship originally proposed for the Italian Navy by designer Vittorio Cuniberti is included, along with other ships cancelled for financial reasons. And the French receive a full class of unusual battleships proposed but never built, that carry the big guns of a dreadnought but also the not-quite-as-big guns of a semi-dreadnought.

And there are some pieces to replace armored cruisers and semi-dreadnoughts from our Mediterranean game, with gunnery ratings more accurately reflecting their capabilities. Plus new seaplane pieces rated for use with the aircraft rules that began to appear in Great War at Sea games after publication of the most recent edition of Mediterranean.

The thirty scenarios study the Triple Alliance war plan in a story all their own, following the outbreak of war and the conduct of operations as the joint planning staff foresaw possible events. The scenarios follow a single story arc, but also present a study of the Triple Alliance’s strengths and weaknesses. It’s a similar approach to that in High Seas Fleet, but with its own story line.
172894.name: Great War at Sea: Triple Alliance
boardgameexpansion: Great War at Sea: Central Powers
Great War at Sea: The Mediterranean

172896.description:
Walk the twisted streets of the Mad City in a boardgame that fuses worker placement with deck building and area control to create a unique experience.

Extract dreams in the City Slumbering and use them to buy favors from Nightmares. Procure special services in the Bizarre Bazaar. Score points through skillful play in Mother When’s deadly High School, and the sinister 13th District. Compete for the Wax King’s favor, and the ultimate prize…escape!

In this game, set in the sinister world of the Don’t Rest Your Head role playing game, your opponents lurk around every corner, waiting to attack. Can you outsmart your friends and win the Nightmares’ game? Whatever you do, Don’t Turn Your Back!
172896.name: Don't Turn Your Back
boardgameexpansion: Don't Turn Your Back: Don't Be a Wick – International Tabletop Day 2016 Promo
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 35 - Interview with Greater Than Games Christopher Badell
The Good, The Board and the “Short List”: Episode 40 “Joe’s Top Games”

172897.name: MegaJail
172897.description:
In the future, crime is out of control. Aliens, gangs, and worse run amok in the unified worlds of the United Galactique. The best solution was the MegaJail, provided by MegaJail Inc., a maximum security franchise.

In MegaJail, the players are Wardens proving who is the best at running a wing of a MegaJail in order to secure a lucrative MegaJail contract. Whoever scores the highest Reputation (your score) after a pre-set turn limit wins. Lots of things influence your Rep - you lose it when Cons (prisoners) escape, or get injured, paroled, or other things. The MegaJail Inc. management also dislikes you spending too much cash, so keep an eye on your budget!

You get Cons in a draft at the beginning of each turn. Then you have a phase with players taking to actions to build new things (like Cells or Facilities). During Lockdown, Cons are put in Cells, which is the major puzzle of the game. Finally News Events happen, Cons may act out, and a new turn is started.

Just scoring the best isn't enough though - Cons cause Hazards, such as Unrest, Contraband, and ongoing Damage - and Cons can get Angry from overcrowding, high Unrest, or other events. If all the Cons are Angry at the end of the turn, the entire MegaJail melts down, and everybody loses.

Part puzzle, part jail sim, part campy. Can you be the best Warden and run your own MegaJail?

172899.description:
ATS OBJECTIVE SCHMIDT is a detailed historical module that tells the story of the Battle of the Huertgen Forest with a broad sweep, and detailed historical map. The presentation is a large as the battle was ... in terms of importance to Allied hopes to be ‘home for Christmas’ ... 1944. Those hopes were dashed by bitter German resistance in the dark, dank wooded hills and villages around the Kall River. Names like Kommerscheidt, Vossenack, and Germeter, not to mention the infamous Kall Trail ... ring out in the history of the battle. Every one of those places is depicted, and more, allowing the tactical-level gamer to contest every inch, or pull back and await reinforcements ... or lay in a mortar barrage ... or stand pat and await new orders. Whatever was possible to local commanders is in YOUR hands as you re-make history in minute detail.

The map presentation is extensive, providing almost a dozen square feet of gaming area with evocative terrain artwork by a professional military illustrator What’s more, when combined with ATS HUERTGEN HELL, OBJECTIVE SCHMIDT creates another CH monster battlefield measuring some six feet in length ... there just has never been anything like it. You’ll be able to gaze across the expanse of the battlefield on both sides of the Kall River, including multiple villages, hundreds of terrain features. And yet, many scenarios play on portions of the overall map area, making the module easy to dive into and get your dice rolling without delay.

The module includes two sheets of 176 5/8” die-cut German and American Personnel and Weapon counters, plus a sheet of 108 AFV/VEHICLES in 3/4” size, a total of 460 counters in all—everything you need to play (just bring your standard ATS markers). You also receive 10 scenarios (all playable on the map provided) in color format, and color Battlefield WalkaroundTM special rules in 3-hole format. THIS IS NOT A COMPLETE GAME! Ownership of the ATS 2014 rulebook and play aids plus standard system small and large marker counters is required (plus one or more 10-sided dice).
172899.name: ATS Historical Module: Objective Schmidt

172901.name: Eberron
172901.description:
From the Introduction:

Welcome to the first installment of Unearthed Arcana, a monthly workshop where D&D R&D shows off a variety of new and interesting pieces of RPG design for use at your gaming table. You can think of the material presented in this series as similar to the first wave of the fifth edition playtest. These game mechanics are in draft form, usable in your campaign but not fully tempered by playtests and design iterations. They are highly volatile and might be unstable; if you use them, be ready to rule on any issues that come up. They’re written in pencil, not ink.

The material presented in Unearthed Arcana will range from mechanics that we expect one day to publish in a supplement to house rules from our home campaigns that we want to share, from core system options such as mass combat to setting-specific material such as the Eberron update included in this article. Once it's out there, you can expect us to check in with you to see how it's working out and what we can do to improve it.

Eberron Update. This month's installment is relatively straightforward. We're rolling out some rules to help you convert your Eberron campaign to fifth edition. The Eberron campaign setting was created by Keith Baker and first published for D&D in 2004. It combines pulp adventure and intrigue in a world where magic-driven technology has produced airships, trains, and similar advancements comparable to early 20th-century Europe. The continent of Khorvaire, the center of Eberron's focus, has recently emerged from the Last War, a terrible conflict that saw the kingdom of Cyre transformed into a lifeless gray wasteland called the Mournland. That catastrophe shocked the remaining kingdoms into an uneasy peace that has held so far.

Full details on the Eberron setting are available in several PDF products available through dndclassics.com. This article focuses on mechanical conversions for several of the key elements unique to Eberron.

172902.name: UNO: Horses
172902.description:
Test your steed's speed as the classic card game meets the world's most majestic breeds in the Horses edition of UNO.


112 Custom Cards featuring beautiful horses of all colors and breeds.
Same great UNO play PLUS the special Horseplay card, which forces other players to swap hands.
Be sure to shout "UNO" as you go for the win.

172903.description:
Two promo cards given for free if you pre-ordered this game from Plaid Hat Games.

EMP Grenade:
Reveal this card. Choose a vehicle within 4 spaces of your agent, hunters cannot move the chosen vehicle or use its equipment (example: motion sensor) until the beginning of your next turn.

Proximity Mine:
Do NOT reveal this card. Mark 'M' on a space up to 2 spaces away from your location. At the start of your turn, if there are 1 or more hunters within 4 spaces of the marked space, reveal this card and stun those hunters.
172903.name: Specter Ops: Pre-Order Promo Cards

172904.description:
Play deadly games of Imperial politics in Relic: Halls of Terra! The quest to save the Antian Sector from Chaos takes you to mankind’s homeworld in the Sol System, where you must persuade the ruling powers of the Imperium to support to your cause. You'll have to prove your worth in tough negotiations with powerful organizations such as the self-interested Imperial Nobility, the ruthless Inquisition, and the mysterious Adeptus Astra Telepathica on your way to stand before the High Lords of Terra and the immortal Emperor himself. But be warned: Imperial politics are just as dangerous as any battle inside the Warp Rift, and blackest corruption festers even in the heart of the Imperium.

Relic: Halls of Terra contains:

A side board depicting the Sol System: Holy Terra, Mars, Titan and Luna
Complete deck of orange Threat cards specific to the Sol System
Affiliation tokens that tie characters to powerful organizations
Three new characters and a new nemesis
Additional Scenarios, Missions, Corruption, Threat, and Relic cards
172904.name: Relic: Halls of Terra

172905.name: Called Away
172905.description:
From publisher blurb:

What happens your characters need to leave?

There are many times in games & stories when a player or character can’t make it to a session or you need to have a certain character not present at the same location as others for a short time. Where did they go? What are they doing when not in play?

This is where “Called Away” can help you to fill in the blanks and give a brief overview of where the character or even an npc has been. The actual details are left up to you, but they can be a good source of future adventures.

The main table has 100 entries suitable for a fantasy or medieval setting with several sub tables helping to flesh out and give further options and ideas.

172906.name: Donnerloch
172906.description:
Players try to buy lots on the game map. Lots will in urn bring the revenues. The lots that pay out are determined by dice.
In the first phase, every player gets one lot for free
In the second phase players can buy additional lots, using the revenues as money.
In the last phase of the game, the lots pay dividends, but every turn there is a high chance that one random lot becomes worthless (i.e. contains a "Donnerloch").
Players win when they buy certain combinations of lots or -if no one is able to - have the most money at the end.

172907.name: The Cathartic Caster (New Wizard Archetype)
172907.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces a new archetype for the Wizard class. The Cathartic Caster offers a relatively simple yet effective method for a slotless spell caster.

172908.name: Metamagic Feats
172908.description:
From publisher blurb:

Metamagic Feats is a special double-sized Mythic Mini bringing you 17 mythic metamagic feats to master magical manipulation of every kind! Whether you're a blasting evoker using Burning Spell and Concussive Spell to lay waste to all in your path, a student of the dead using Thanatopic Spell or Threnodic Spell to bring the undead under your way, or a shadow mage using Tenebrous Spell or Shadow Grasp to bring the onset of eternal night, this product brings you mythic versions of every metamagic feat from Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Ultimate Magic and MORE!

172909.name: "C" is for "Cosmic"
172909.description:
From publisher blurb:

Go Beyond!

This entry in the Icons A to Z series looks at cosmic forces, characters, and settings including:

Cosmic-scale abilities and how to handle them
Cosmic characters and powers
Blowing up planets
Action in outer space
Cosmic entities

172910.name: Back Alley
172910.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a full-color, 8 x 10 inch map of a Back Alley, and includes the VTT (Virtual Table top) files.

“So you boys like to party huh? Well your party ends here tonight” [Thugs draw their switchblades and holdout pistols]

Take the fight to the back alleys of the city with our latest freebie! The environment is filled with debris that can be used as improvised weapons or shields. A martial artist might take advantage of the planks and pipes as weapons or toss boxes as feints. A tough guy might throw steel drums, tires, or even the TV or use the steel locker as a shield. A strong super hero might even throw the couch!

Back Alley is a single page map of a debris filled alleyway lot.

Back Alley is intended for use in modern, pulp adventure, post-apocalyptic, or super hero games.

Adventure Hook for use with this map:

Mysterious Donations: A local fraternity, Delta Epsilon Omicron, has stumbled upon a new party drug that a nerdy pledge cooked up for them. They have started selling it in a nearby back street alley behind the frat house. They are trying to make enough money to have the biggest frat party ever and become campus legends. The cash they make is being funneled to the frat house by “anonymous” donors. A local gang of drug dealers have taken notice of their recent drug sales and are not happy about them taking money out of their pockets.

The drug dealers have contacted the frat posing as college kids and set up a meeting to buy drugs from them tonight. The gang is actually going to wax them to get rid of the competition instead.

The Player Characters can be detectives or police officers who have become aware of the drug sales and are staking out the area that night in a sting operation to observe the sale and bust the frat boys and drug dealers. When the thugs come in to buy drugs and they start firing instead, they have to leap into action to save the frat kids if they can.

One twist is that the drug is actual a revenge cooked up by the nerdy pledge tired of hazing and bullying. Those who use the drug are driven to euphoria, but over time the drug starts to physically change its users into ugly monsters with each new dose. The frat boys turn into abominations in this case and rip the thugs apart. The Player Characters rush to save them, only to find themselves going up against hideous, muscle-bound creatures that barely react to pain despite bullet holes in them from the thugs. Another twist is that the Player Characters are actually super heroes who use the detective or police officer occupations as masks for their real identities and can fight this threat directly.

172911.name: Hellspike
172911.description:
From publisher blurb:

Daymar Sanctus, a scholarly wizard, began construction of his “Suspended Abode of Wondrous Enchantment” over two decades ago. Using knowledge gathered over the years he sought to build the most unique wizard’s tower yet seen. Initial construction began with traditional laborers and craftsmen, but as time went on his laborers grew more and more exotic. Eventually even these laborers proved insufficient for the construction task at hand. Frustrated, Daymar began calling his project Hellspike in an attempt to frame his ongoing nightmare in a humorous light. With his own sanity of mind fading, Daymar bound a minor demon to help him finish the construction of the tower with his own magic. Recently a magical mishap changed the situation, and the tower’s enchantments begin to falter.

A Pocket-Sized Encounter compatible with the Swords & Wizardry rules system for 3rd to 5th level characters.

Pocket-Sized Encounters from Iron Tavern Press are shorter scenarios designed to be dropped into an existing campaign with minimal preparation. Use them for shorter sessions, provide your players with choices that won’t derail your campaign or even as a launching point for a new campaign path.

Included in this product are:

Multiple adventure hooks
Location based encounter area map
Seeds for expanding the adventure
Wizard Beads (minor magic item)

172912.description:
User summary:

戦列ペンギン (Senretsu Penguin) is a follow-up game to Siege Penguins, and continues the story of the epic penguin civil wars.

It is a 2 player game about the war between the North and the South (like the American Civil War) in the world of penguins.
Each player uses 5 action cards effectively to change the war situation and aims to march towards the stronghold of the opponent, or defeat his armies thoroughly so that their morale is broken.

Publisher's summary:
"ペンギン世界の南北戦争を題材とした２人用対戦ゲームです。
５枚のアクションカードを駆使して戦況を動かし、
最終的に相手の本拠地に攻め上るか、あるいは、
士気がドン底に落ちるほどコテンパンに叩き潰すことを目指します。
172912.name: Senretsu Penguin

rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
172913.name: Wrath of the Frost Queen
172913.description:
From publisher blurb:

Powerful blizzards are overwhelming logging and mining camps, with attacks by strange, six-limbed snow-beasts threatening life on the frontier. Tales of a beautiful woman luring men to their deaths in the storms are proving themselves to be true, as more and more frontiersmen are having strange dreams. Now Irondelve has gone silent, and those the Merchants’ Consortium sent to investigate the town did not return. It is up to you to investigate Irondelve, find the lost miners, and discover the source of these strange storms. Will you uncover the mystery, or fall to the Wrath of the Frost Queen?

Wrath of the Frost Queen is a fully-detailed adventure for 4-6 player heroes of 5th level. It is fully compatible with the DCC RPG, and written in the spirit of old school fantasy roleplaying adventures.

This Module Includes:

Illustrations throughout
Hand drawn maps of numbered locations
10 All-New Monsters to haunt your heroes
New Patron for players, including patron spells, Spellburn, patron-specific corruption, and more
Fully-described magical items
Madness-based Corruption charts
A puzzle reward for clever players

172914.name: Eldritch Role Playing System Revised Edition
172914.description:
From publisher blurb:

A fast-paced, action and story oriented RPG of high fantasy, with no restrictive archetypes:
character concept is king! Cast any spell, wield any weapon desired, possess any power imagined. Players can create detailed characters quickly, with rules that are easy to master and yet offer a lot of scope for clever and creative play. Eldritch Role Playing Revised now includes the detailed yet adaptable campaign setting, known by sages as Ainerêve, where heroes fulfill their destinies in a world of dream, might and magic. So sharpen your sword, gather your will, and summon your inner strength to prepare for a new game experience…

172915.name: Tower Shield Fleet Yard
172915.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible space station. The station introduced in this installment of the series is a massive fleet yard.

The PDF contains the background of the station, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains an image depicting the station. This PDF contains NO deckplan!

172916.name: Starburst Sentinels (ICONS)
172916.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you need some Ooga-Chaka in your game? Well - The Starburst Sentinels are a rag-tag band of cosmic adventurers. They're statted up and ready for action in your ICONS game as PCs, allies or even antagonists.

Meta-Prince - Roguish former pirate who leads the Sentinels
Cosmic Coati - Fuzzy, cute and very dangerous
Klim - Sentient tree who is the heart of the Sentinels
Vaxon - A stern warrior on a mission of vengeance
Barata - One of the most deadly assassins in the galaxy

172917.name: Buried Council Chambers (Pathfinder)
172917.description:
From publisher blurb:

For 4-6 PCs Levels 2-3

Long ago these chambers served as a meeting place for dignitaries and politicians. Those responsible for maintaining the well-being of the people also held the hidden agenda of ensuring their own permanent and corrupt installment as overseers to the general populace. A cataclysmic event long ago buried these chambers deep underground, they have not been disturbed prior to the PCs finding the entrance in the ceiling.

172919.name: Contagion Gamemaster Screen
172919.description:
From publisher blurb:

This multi-panel Gamemaster Screen offers numerous charts and tables for use with Contagion Second Edition.

Exterior panels include a blank hex grid and combat tracker for the Gamemaster to use in play. When used with the DriveThruRPG Game Master Screen (portrait), a dry erase marker can safely be used to maximize the utility of these screens.

172920.name: Sinkirou No Junijikan
172920.description:
User summary:
蜃気楼の12時間 (Sinkirou No Junijikan) is a game which takes place in a mirage house that exists for just 12 hours. In this game of mystery and suspense, four gentlemen, namely an Englishman, a Detective, a Thief and a Murderer, enter the house (Sinkirou-tei). Whilst they play out 12 rounds of the game, each person tries to keep their identity secret whilst also achieving their hidden goals.

Publisher summary:
"蜃気楼邸に集まった4人の紳士が織り成す
サスペンスパーティー。
プレーヤーは英国紳士・探偵紳士・怪盗紳士・殺戮紳士
のいずれかに扮して、自らの正体を隠しつつ12ラウンドを過ごし、
それぞれに定められた勝利条件を目指します。"

172921.name: Rune Casters
172921.description:
From publisher blurb:

Introducing, Rune Casters:

An expert magic system for levels 1-5, Rune Casters contains the rules and procedures for the arcane art of rune casting for the Torchbearer RPG. Also included are two sample character classes which are capable of such magic:

The dwarf wanderer, who walks many paths.
The fisk gambler, who presses his luck.




No longer are runes the exclusive domain of hidden wizards and proud dwarf clans. Whether you will boon your companions with unmatched strengths, or curse your enemies with confusion and withering, the power of rune casting is yours to wield.

172922.name: Fantasy Cthulhu
172922.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a big fantasy setting for FATE, which has been invaded by the terrible nasties of the Cthulhu Mythos. The game includes a fantasy continent, divided into realms. These realms include human city states, elven forest kingdoms, halfling mounds and dwarven halls, and they are all in imminent danger of what happens when the stars align and the gates have been opened.

This distinctive background, with a high-fantasy feel, integrates beautifully with the cosmic horror of the Cthulhu Mythos. Send your players out against Mighty Cthulhu himself with just a sword to protect themselves.

This PDF includes everything needed to start playing, with character creation rules, a bestiary, descriptions of realms, gear, a synopsis of the FATE Core rules tailored for cosmic horror, and some gritty detail on the advantages and disadvantages of various weapons and armor.

So start exploring this fantasy version of Cthulhu.

172923.name: Lizardfolk
172923.description:
From publisher blurb:


Strength of Scale and Spear!

The lizardfolk are an ancient people with a storied past and traditions untroubled by the passage of time. Their strength is hidden, their teeth and claws sheathed until the moment is right.

Advanced Races: Lizardfolk is your essential guide to this ancient race of brutal warriors and cunning witches. Their mastery of blood and bone is deep and unforgiving; their wrath is slow but sure.

This 13-page PDF by designers Steven T. Helt, Stephen Rowe, and Dan Dillon includes:

Racial stats for lizardfolk PCs, plus 11 alternate racial traits from climber to purple-blooded, and from giant-sized to water-runner
9 new racial feats, including Brutal Strike, Burst of Speed, and Tail Wielder
6 new archetypes including Ambush Predator (Rogue), Primitive Weapon Master (Fighter), Saurian Champion (Cavalier), Sanguine Scale (Witch), Story Keeper (Skald), and Pestilent Savage (Barbarian)
New Saurian Champion mounts including pterandodon, stegosaurus, and tyrannosaurus
6 new lizardfolk spells and 3 new magic items,
Plus the sample Bloodscale tribe and more!




It's all here—get Advanced Races: Lizardfolk today and get in touch with primal power!

172924.name: Beneath the Spire / Tunnels & Skulls
172924.description:
From publisher blurb:

Back for more adventure?

Return to a world of post-apocalyptic gonzo adventure with One Day Digs Double Feature 3 & 4! This evening’s first flick is irresistible, especially to those cyborgs in your team! Beneath the Spire will electrify your PCs, then, after a short intermission, dim the lights for Tunnels & Skulls, a post-apocalyptic random sewer generator!

Designed for introductory games at conventions, game stores, and private home tables, One Day Digs are the brain child of author Brandon Goeringer and illustrated by Will McAusland. They are crafted to showcase a bit of The Mutant Epoch setting and flavor, introduce some creatures and relics, as well as offer an example of how the Outland System game mechanic works. For the most part, these adventures are for 4 to 6 new PCs of first rank. Not using the Mutant Epoch rules? No sweat, GM’s can easily convert the stats found in these mini-adventures to some other mechanic.

Beneath the Spire is best suited to character parties with one or two cyborgs, and involves the investigation of a mysterious tower in the wastes, as well as the soothing promises to those of flesh and chrome, bone and steel. This adventure includes a full page map and new robotic nightmare to challenge your players. Tunnels & Skulls involves an assortment of adventure hooks, a random sewer tunnel generator, two grid sheets for your own sewer network maps, a random encounter table, d100 treasure table plus an all new creature (pictured on the cover).

172925.name: The Ruinous Beauty
172925.description:
User summary:
The Ruinous Beauty is the English name given by the game designer to his game 傾国-KEIKOKU- although the game is not released in English yet. The Ruinous Beauty implies a femme fatale.

A two-player game staged in the spring-fall era of China (770 – 220 BC). Players play cards face down, determine their powers, and may move their troops forward as much as they have bet on the outcome. The first player to gain 21 points wins. Wisely using the Spies that you can send into your enemy's country, and the Imperial Ordnance that give you an advantage in battle, are the keys to victory.

Publisher summary:
中国の春秋戦国時代をモチーフにした2人専用ゲーム。伏せられたカードの強弱で勝負し、賭けたチップの分だけ兵を進めます。21ポイント先取すれば勝利。敵国に送り込んだ【潜伏者】と、戦いを有利に進める【勅令】をうまく使い、対戦者を出し抜きましょう!

172926.name: Shadowed Earth Cryptozoology #01: Chaos Realm (Savage Worlds)
172926.description:
From publisher blurb:

We at the Inquisition like to think we know as much as humanly possible about the supernatural world that surrounds us every day. Unfortunately, that’s not only a daunting task, it’s almost impossible. We discover new chaotic beings often, new otherworldly beings summoned to Earth, and the remnants of non-human societies. It is with great displeasure that I concede to the overwhelming magnitude of the supernatural world and must admit that even the Inquisition remains partially naïve.

The Cryptozoology is a culmination of facts, theories, and speculations as researched and documented by the Inquisition. Each publication contains a collection of adversaries for use within Savage Worlds across all Shadowed Earth settings. Cryptozoology #01: Chaos Realm presents a collection of demons and demonic beings that can be used throughout any era and within any location.

Cryptozoology #01: Chaos Realm includes:

30 unique demons and demonic beings
Descriptions for each entry
Illustration for each entry
A description of the classifications used throughout the series




Although Cryptozoology #01: Chaos Realm is designed for use in any Shadowed Earth setting, the adversaries can be universally placed within any Savage Worlds fantasy or horror adventure or setting.

172927.name: Bandits!
172927.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bandits prey on the weak out on the edges of the civilized world, whether out in the wilderness, on inner city streets, or in some far off galaxy. They fight, they steal, and sometimes they stand for something greater than themselves. These folks exist in our game worlds and sometimes need a little inspiration to bring them to life.

But who are they? Are they Robin Hood-style thieves, stealing from the rich and giving back to the poor? Are they bandits from the Wild West, out to rob the stagecoach and rustle the cattle? Or are they a vicious gang out to cause maximum destruction in the waste, Mad Max-style?

Insta-NPCs #8: Bandits! offers a little guidance to create any or all of these... that bit of spark to bring your bandits into your worlds of adventure with more than just the sound of thundering hooves to signify their approach. Six tables, including nine examples and a 100-item table of descriptors to flavor your descriptions further.

Let's go through an example. Perhaps I need a group of bandits to attack the PCs in the forest. I pull out the dice and come up with these terms...

Purpose: Fame
Style: Criminal
Public perception: Tolerated
Latest act: Reviled
Chosen stage: Wilderness
Descriptor: Pleasant




I might build those terms into...

"Adward Hames and the Scarlet Gang have plagued the Knykurt Wood for the last five years, attacking rich travelers on the King's Road and then disappearing into the trees with their loot. The red-clad bandits have always been polite to their targets, until recently. The people in the area tolerated them until a few weeks ago when they mistakenly attacked a beloved merchant and his family. The trader Lero was killed trying to defend his daughter from an overzealous attacker. The towns of Barnsley, Kelna, and Banrock have put together a reward of 500 gold for anyone who can bring Hames and his gang to justice."

Will the PCs capture these bandits or take justice into their own hands?

Bandits! can be used for any setting or system. Need bandits for a science fiction, fantasy, or western adventure? I bet this will help!

172928.name: #Harshmode Monday (#13 - Feb 2, 2015)
172928.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every Monday the creative team from Harsh Realities will offer up small pdf documents to showcase the vast capability of the Sixcess game mechanic!

Each #Harshmode Monday will feature an NPC, Creature, Location, Adventure Seed, or any number of other interesting and useful bits for your gaming table!

172929.name: Greyhound vs. Bear: The Raid on Astrakhan, 1942
172929.description:
The German raid on Astrakhan marks the eastern-most limit of the Axis invasion of the Soviet Union during WWII. What is remarkable is the small number of German units assigned to this sector, just the 16th Motorized Infantry (Greyhound) division, given the frontage and lack of substantial information regarding the Soviet’s forces. It was due to this lack of intelligence about the Soviet’s intentions and movements that the division’s reconnaissance battalion, along with some sympathetic Cossacks, was sent out from Elista on September 13th. The unit’s four day raid took them 90 miles beyond the Axis occupied village to the outskirts of Astrakhan during which they destroyed a fuel train, gathered intelligence about the nature of the Soviet’s forces, and set off alarms in the region that sent STAVKA scrambling to deal with the threat.

Greyhound vs. Bear portrays the German raid and Soviet response in a quick playing and easy to learn mini-game. Players use a standard deck of playing cards to activate their units and resolve combats. The game is also easy to play solitaire.

172930.name: Tsunami Quarterly Review (Issue 9 - Winter 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Breathing New Life Into Your Game World
172930.description:
From publisher blurb:

In our beautifully reformatted and reimagined ninth issue of Tsunami Quarterly Review, you will find the following great features:

RPG Crucible: Outside the Box: Explore a creative approach to matching disparate backgrounds with your new character's current career path.
Coloring Between the Lines: The Radiating Gnome extracts the most graceful elements of 4E skill challenges and demonstrates how they can enhance game play in other systems.
Bringing New Life Into Your Game World: Tips and tricks for creating a living, breathing setting that your players can see evolving around them.
Tsunami Living Campaign: We launch our living campaign with information on the primary maguffin and the numerous factions which are hell-bent on possessing it. Join the quest for the Shards of Malvoc and become part of campaign history!
Patchouli and Sandalwood: JiB discusses some basic mechanics from some of the most prominent rules-light systems and how they can be used in traditional games.
The Mortlock, Pt 2: Jonikka Frazier continues the grim story of Sharia Mortlock in the time before the events of the Obsidian Crown Actual Play adventure.

172931.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Mrs. Plumpert's prized pot pie has gone missing, and now it's a chicken chase to crack the case!

In Outfoxed, you move around the board to gather clues, then use the special evidence scanner to rule out suspects. You have to work together quickly because the guilty fox is high-tailing it towards the exit! Will you halt the hungry hooligan before it flies the coop — or will you be outfoxed?
172931.name: Outfoxed
boardgamepodcastepisode: 38 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Twice Married

172932.name: Flashlights & Fireflies
172932.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Get ready for a backyard dash-through-the-dark in this game of firefly-powered flashlight freeze tag! First, catch fireflies to power up your flashlight, then shine it on other players before they sneak back to home base. All along, watch out for bats, raccoons, and other nighttime critters that are out to trip up your tracks.

Be the first to reach home in Flashlights & Fireflies and you've outshined the competition!

172933.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Dare to enter Dragonwood! Deep in the heart of this mythical forest lurk angry ogres, giggling goblins, and even the famed and fearsome fire-breathers themselves!

In Dragonwood, you collect sets of adventurer cards to earn dice, which you then use to roll against your foes. Stomp on some fire ants, scream at a grumpy troll, or strike the menacing orange dragon with a magical silver sword. Choose your strategy carefully because the landscape of Dragonwood is ever-changing. Only the bravest will overcome the odds to emerge victorious!

Gameplay:

On their turn, players either draw a card or attempt to capture a creature or enhancement. Players draw from the Adventurer deck that contains cards of 5 different colors all numbered 1-12. With these cards players form combinations to attempt a Strike (cards in a row of any color), a Stomp (cards of the same number) or a Scream (cards of the same color). To capture, players roll a number of dice equal to the number of cards they have of the particular combination. Each creature has different minimum values of a Strike, Stomp or Scream needed to capture it, and a Victory Point amount.

The game includes six, six-sided dice with sides 1, 2, 2, 3, 3, and 4 to reduce extremely lucky outcomes. The Dragonwood deck has 42 cards, 5 of which are displayed in the landscape at any time. In addition to creatures, this deck also has enhancements that are captured in the same way as creatures which assist players in capturing creatures, and contains events that also impact play. When both dragons have been defeated, the game is over and the player with the most victory points wins!

Is the best strategy to go for several smaller creatures or save up for larger attacks? Should you grab some enhancements hoping they will pay off, or go immediately for creatures? Do you take chances on some rolls or go for sure things? Every time you play Dragonwood the deck is different, so no two games are the same!
172933.name: Dragonwood
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 61- Pandemic Legacy and Jeremy Hot Seat (Spoiler Free)
HLG 7: Op de foto
The Game Pit Podcast: Episode 63 - UK Games Expo 2016

172934.name: Errands
172934.description:
The people in Errandtown need your help!

In this game your goal is to complete errands that the people in Errandtown need help with. The players take turns to move through town and collecting what's on their current errand. To really master this game you'll have to remember where everything is in town and know where to find it when you need it. Errands is a quick and easy game to learn but quite hard to master.

For each errand you complete you get a certain score. The first player over a set value (depending on the amount of players playing) is the winner.

On your way to victory you'll find clipboard cards that will help you or will make it harder for other players to complete their errands.

The game is perfect for both young and old players. For the youngest players it may be a good way to learn English.

172935.name: Kanju
172935.description:
User summary:

漢獣 (Kanju) is a language-based game whereby, from the kanji radicals, you try to guess the four-character idiom cards in your opponents' hands. The game starts by selecting two of the five idiom cards you're dealt. Therefore, the game is very language-dependent and you need a reasonable knowledge of Japanese to play it.

Publisher's summary:
漢字の部首や画数をヒントにして、対戦相手の四字熟語を推理する推理ゲームです。 四字熟語は最初の手札の５枚の中からプレイで使う２枚を選び、ゲームをスタートします。

172936.name: The Pirate GM's Sinister Fist
172936.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This GM Accessory is compatible with both Pathfinder and 5th Edition.

Do you want to run detailed and interesting nautical-themed games that your players will remember for years to come? Well, then you've come to the right place, Matey.

Within these pages are the tables and charts a GM needs to create the salty backgrounds for fun and detailed nautical characters (PC's or NPC's) in any RPG, even if you get seasick taking a bath.

Listed here are the wonders to be found inside:

Numerous Tables for Creating Nautical Backgrounds for both PC's and NPC's

25 Boarding Parties with Leaders, Numbers, Arms, and Tactics

25 “Harbormaster Rumors” Adventure Hooks

Critical Hit and Critical Failure charts for Belaying Pins, Clubs, Batons, Knives, Cutlasses, Rapiers, Pikes, Spears, Pistols, Muskets, and Cannons

Plus More Besides . . .

Catch the Pirate GM's Sinister Fist today, before it knocks you out.

172937.name: Perfect Alliance
172937.description:
User summary:
パーフェクトアライアンス (Perfect Alliance) is a game from Japan produced by Loto&Beyser games.

It is a draft game where you use resources to complete quests. During the draft, if the conditions fit, the players become allies, and the goal is to complete the quest together with your ally.

Publisher summary:
リソースを使ってクエストの条件をクリアするドラフトゲームです。ドラフトでは条件が揃うとプレイヤー同士が仲間になり、 最終的に決定した仲間と一緒にクエストのクリアを目指すことになります。

172938.name: O Castelo de S. Jorge
172938.description:
The S. Jorge Castle in the city of Lisbon knew several lords throughout the centuries. It passed from Roman hands to Arabs and finally to Christians. Chief among them were the Vizier Al-Fihrî, D. Afonso Henriques, and King D. Manuel II.

In O Castelo de S. Jorge each player takes the role of a character from the S. Jorge Castle's history. To become the winner and true Lord of the Castle, they vie to obtain Trophies and accrue the highest possible number of victory points.

Each player's turn consists of two phases. In the first you may move your character to another space on the board. In the second, you may take one of two possible actions: collect a Trophy from your character's current location or place a new Trophy somewhere on the board.

The game ends when the time comes to place a new Trophy on the board and none yet remain in the pool. Whoever has the most points at this time is the winner!

172939.name: Poupar para Ganhar!
172939.description:
Poupar para Ganhar! is a simple game in which 2 participants attempt to play Action cards that allow them to save more for their family than the other. Which Action cards gain you the most points is dependent on your Objective cards.

Turns go through 3 phases:


Claiming Objective cards
Playing Action cards
Drawing Action cards to bring your hand total up to 3


Play ends when both piles of Objective cards have been depleted OR when a player reaches the third turn phase and is unable to draw back up to 3 Action cards. Whoever has managed their households the best and accrued the most savings points is the winner.

172940.name: Suspend Junior
172940.description: Building on the tremendous success of Suspend, the new Junior version brings this blockbuster balance game to younger kids with brighter colors, lighter pieces, and a brand-new spinner. Game play is easy: Simply set up the frame, spin the spinner, and balance the color-coded pieces to create an incredible hanging structure. Race against your opponents to be the first to run out of pieces-but watch out: One wrong move and the whole structure could fall! This thrilling game is perfect for young players-there is no reading required, and the skills to succeed grow with every game. Kids learn how to balance and counterbalance, take smart risks, and foresee consequences, all the while having lots of fun!

172941.name: Medieval Arms Dealer
172941.description:
War can be profitable. Five medieval factions are at war. It's your job to keep them supplied. Visit the Medieval underground and acquire weapon contracts. Use your wagons, actions and gold wisely. Be quick to finish the contracts before your enemies do!

The medieval underground contain contracts of items to purchase. These contracts will contain 3, 4 or 5 items. There are 10 different weapons to shop for. Your playing hand starts with five items that you need to match to the contracts in the dungeon market. Don't worry if you are missing an item, you can always trade in the market if the item is available. Purchase new wagons to hold more items to complete more contracts. Watch out for the events that will destroy the market and steal your weapons! Plan your 2 actions per turn well and you will profit from war! End of game bonuses await you if you are clever enough to sell to the same faction or to all of them.

The game works very well with 1, 2, 3 or 4 players. A 2 player game is about 20 minutes.

172942.description:
Promo Pack #1 consists of three cards all labeled Promo Pack #1 in white text at the bottom

Toltan the Bard is a neutral Supporter card with a Fast Action that allows you to return one of your treasures to the bottom of the Vault deck to gain 4 IP.

Crystal Skull is a consumable Vault card that costs 2 coins. It has a Fast Action that lets you learn a spell from the tableau without spending INT, placing this card on it. It can never be researched further.

Ancient Tablet is a Treasure that costs 4 coins. It has an Action that allows you to move one of your mages on the board to any empty slot.
172942.name: Argent:  Promo Pack #1

172943.name: Combat Description Cards
172943.description:
Publisher's description:

Over 700 System Neutral Ways to Describe Combat on 120 Cards.

We've all been there. You're running your favorite table-top RPG and it's combat time. You roll the dice, hit, then calculate damage. What does the GM say?

"You hit for 17 damage."

What will he say next time?

"You hit for 16 damage."

Booor-ing!

The rest of the game is so imaginative, so immersed in the world; let's not let combat be the one thing that breaks the flow. Instead, we propose enhancing your combat narrative with this easy-to-use descriptive card deck.

Using the Cards: Use these cards as inspiration to add depth, excitement and drama to your fight scenes!

1) Choose from the below categories, a suite of cards that best match the type of damage your character inflicts:

BLUNT: Damage caused by non-penetrating force.

SLASHING: Damage caused by a sharp edge.

PIERCING: Damage caused by a sharp point.

2) Choose one of the styles below, based on the style of combat being performed:

FINESSE: A character who fights with style and grace, like a Swashbuckler or Martial Artist.

POWER: A character who fight is based on strength and vigor, such as the Barbarian or Thug.

RANGE: A character who is using a thrown or distance weapon such as a javelin or bow.

The Action Word and Card Stacking: You can select one or multiple action words to describe your attack.
